intro: Mogiphanes brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The fruit, which is edible, has a sweet and tangy flavor, making it a popular fruit in local markets.
